metadata.title: CVE-2023-4573 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
When receiving rendering data over IPC `mStream` could have been destroyedwhen initialized, which could have led to a use-after-free causing apotentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 117,Firefox ESR < 102.15, Firefox ESR < 115.2, Thunderbird < 102.15, andThunderbird < 115.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4573` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.15.1+build1-0ubuntu0.23.04.1').
mozjs78 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs102 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
